topic.title: Deploying Content Fusion Enterprise Using VMware vSphere (Deprecated)

keywords.indexterm: Installing an Enterprise server with VMware vSphere

body.note: To make upgrades and security updates easier, this VMware installation kit has been deprecated and is scheduled for removal. If your are using this platform, you can start a Virtual Machine that runs one of the supported Linux distributions and use the Linux installer.
body.p: This topic contains information for the server administrator about how to install and configure an using VMware vSphere.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p:
An Enterprise server solution requires the following prerequisites:
VMware vSphere
8 GB of memory on the server (see Memory Limits).
2 virtual CPUs

section.title: Downloading the Oxygen Content Fusion Enterprise Virtual Machine Software
section.p: To use your own server with VMware vSpere, you need to go to the Download page, and in the VMware tab, download the virtual machine software package. The download package includes an OVA file that defines the virtual machine.

section.title: Importing the Oxygen Content Fusion Virtual Machine Software
section.p:
To import the Oxygen Content Fusion Enterprise virtual machine software in VMware vSphere:
Start VMware vSphere.
Select File / Deploy OVF Template and choose the OVA file.
Select the Power on after deployment option in the final step.
After powering on the virtual machine, click Launch Virtual Machine Console.

section.title: Initial Command Line/SSH Access Configuration
section.p:
To configure the command-line/SSH access to the VM, use the following procedure:
On the first start of the server, the VM console will display the IP address (you will need this), and the SSH access administrator user name and password (these will be changed). The fingerprint of the HTTPS self-signed certificate is also displayed. If you do not see this information, press Enter and it will be displayed.
Log in to the machine using the credentials displayed in step 1. You can do this either directly in the virtual machine console or by using SSH.
After you log in, you will be prompted to change the default password for the administration account. This password can be used to log in to the VM using SSH or the VM console.
Exit the console by typing exit.
section.note: The Virtual Machine uses DHCP to acquire an IP address. If you do not have a DHCP server in your network, you will have to disable DHCP and assign an IP address yourself.
